meanings.definition: A lower limit or level within a structure.
meanings.sent1: The subceiling of the basement was painted white to make the room brighter.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers installed lights on the subceiling to illuminate the area.
meanings.sent3: The spider decided to build its web on the subceiling, thinking it was the perfect spot.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition knew no subceiling, reaching heights others could only dream of.
meanings.sent5: The subceiling creaked ominously, as if holding back secrets within its confines.

meanings.sent1: The subceiling had intricate patterns that added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: Water stains on the subceiling indicated a leak in the roof above.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to hide on top of the subceiling, surprising everyone who entered.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a subceiling of thoughts, each one waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The subceiling seemed to mirror the sky above, creating a sense of endless space.
